detaileddescription.para: The reference to the experiment this ResourceDB belongs to.
Flag indicating if this resourceDB should be listed in the debug output file.

Stores for every resource pool (the Res is the key to the hashtable) a Vector holding all the pairs of a SimProcess and the number of resources the SimProcess holds at the moment (see the inner class AssignedResources).

Stores for every SimProcess the resource pool (Res) he is requesting resources from and the number of requested resources (see the inner class RequestedResources). The SimProcess is building the key to the table entries which in turn are holding objects of the inner class RequestedResources.

Stores for every resource pool (the Res is the key to the hashtable) the effective available capacity of the resource as an Integer object. Which is the sum of the current available capactiy of resources in the Res pool and the returned units of that Res pool due to reduction (the units which might be returned in the future because they are not stuck in a deadlock).
Stores all the visited resources when traversing the resource allocation graph. Maybe another implementation is performing better. You are invited to think about it.
Stores all the visited SimProcesses when traversing the resource allocation graph. Maybe another implementation is performing better. You are invited to think about it.
Stores all the SimProcesses which are involved in a deadlock. Is filled when the method checkForDeadlock() is called.
Stores all the resource pools (Res) which are involved in a deadlock. The Vector is filled when the method checkForDeadlock() is called.

Stores all the visited resources when traversing the resource allocation graph is done with examining all it's children vertices. Maybe another implementation is performing better. You are invited to think about it.

Stores all the visited SimProcesses when traversing the resource allocation graph is done with examining all it's children vertices. Maybe another implementation is performing better. You are invited to think about it.
Stores the cycle in the resource allocation graph as a string representation. Is built up as the graph containing the cycle (deadlock) is drawn.
Stores all the elements not belonging to the the cycle in the resource allocation graph as a string representation. Is built up as the graph containing the cycle (deadlock) is drawn.
Indicates the method where something has gone wrong. Is passed as a parameter to i.e. the method checkProcess().
Indicates whether a cycle in the resource allocation graph is found or not. Is set to true if a cycle (and therefore a possible deadlock) is found and false if no cycle is found.

This private constructor is defined to prevent the compiler from generating a default public constructor. This constructor is called from the constructor of Experiment to make sure that for every experiment there is a new resource DB. The debug output for this ResourceDB is turned on by default. But you have to make sure, that the default output for the experiment is turned on, too.

parameterdescription.para: desmoj.Experiment : the experiment this resource database belongs to.

detaileddescription.para: Creates and sends a debugnote to the experiment's messagedistributor. Debugnotes express the internal state of the ResourceDB to visualize the changes of state to help find bugs. The information about the simulation time is extracted from the experiment and must not be given as a parameter.

parameterdescription.para: java.lang.String : The description of the ResourceDB's internal state to be passed with this debugnote

detaileddescription.para:
Sends a message to the messagedistributor handled by the experiment. This ResourceDB must already be connected to an experiment in order to have a messagedistributor available to send this message to and an appropriate messagereceiver must already be registered at the messagedistributor to receive that type of message passed on to it. If no messaging subsystem is available to this ResourceDB, then the mesage is printed to the standard out printstream as configured in the local Java runtime environment of the computer this simulation is running on. Note that there are shorthands for sending the standard DESMO-J messages. These methods create and send the appropriate Message on-the-fly:
sendTraceNote()</clode> to send a tracenote
sendDebugNote() to send the data needed to debug models
sendWarning() to send an errormessage that does not stop the experiment
m
Message : The message to be transmitted
ResourceDB::sendTraceNote
ResourceDB::sendDebugNote
ResourceDB::sendWarning

Creates and sends a tracenote to the experiment's messagedistributor. The information about the simulation time, model and component producing this tracenote is extracted from the experiment and must not be given as parameters.

parameterdescription.para: java.lang.String : The description of the tracenote

memberdef.argsstring: (String description, String location, String reason, String prevention)
memberdef.name: sendWarning

detaileddescription.para: Creates and sends an error message to warn about a erroneous condition in the DESMO-J framework to the experiment's messagedistributor. Be sure to have a correct location, since the object and method that the error becomes apparent is not necessary the location it was produced in. The information about the simulation time is extracted from the Experiment and must not be given as a parameter.

parameterdescription.para: java.lang.String : The description of the error that occured
java.lang.String : The class and method the error occured in
java.lang.String : The reason most probably responsible for the error to occur
java.lang.String : The measures a user should take to prevent this warning to be issued again

detaileddescription.para: Checks the additional status of a deadlock, i.e. if the deadlock is a pending or a transient one. Returns true if it is a pending deadlock and false if it is a transient deadlock.

simplesect.para: boolean :true if it is a pending deadlock and false if it is a transient deadlock.

detaileddescription.para: Checks whether the process using the ResourceDB is a valid process.

simplesect.para: boolean : Returns whether the SimProcess is valid or not.

parameterdescription.para: SimProcess : Is this SimProcess a valid one?

detaileddescription.para: Checks whether the resource pool Res using the ResourceDB is a valid Res.

simplesect.para: boolean : Returns whether the Res is valid or not.

parameterdescription.para: Res : Is this resource pool Res a valid one?

detaileddescription.para: Try to find a cycle in the resource allocation graph starting with the vertex specified in the parameter SimProcess vertex. If we can spot a cycle in the resource allocation graph it is likely that we have found a deadlock.

parameterdescription.para: desmoj.SimProcess : The point to start the search of the resource allocation graph to find a deadlock (cycle in the graph).

detaileddescription.para: Try to find a cycle in the resource allocation graph starting with the vertex specified in the parameter Res vertex. If we can spot a cycle in the resource allocation graph it is likely that we have found a deadlock.

parameterdescription.para: desmoj.Res : The point to start the search of the resource allocation graph to find a deadlock (cycle in the graph).

detaileddescription.para: Calculates the new effective available capacity of all resources the given SimProcess holds units from. The given SimProcess will return the resources he holds in the future, so the returning resource units will be added to the effective available capacity of the resources.

parameterdescription.para: desmoj.SimProcess : the SimProcess which will return the resources it holds in the future. So the returning resource units can be added to the effective available capacity of the resources.

detaileddescription.para: This method is called when a SimProcess can not get the resources desired to check if a possible deadlock situation has occured.

parameterdescription.para: desmoj.SimProcess : The SimProcess which can not get the resources desired. The unsatisfied process.

simplesect.para: boolean : is true if a deadlock is found, false otherwise.

detaileddescription.para: Shows if this resourceDB currently produces debug output.

simplesect.para: boolean : true, if resourceDB shows in debug, false if not

detaileddescription.para: Switches off debug output for this resourceDB.
Switches on debug output for this resourceDB.

Deletes an entry in the resource data base (should be called when a Sim-process is done with it's requested number of resources from a resource pool (Res )). The SimProcess and the number of requested resources will be deleted in the corresponding Vector (of the Res pool) in the assignment hashtable. The Res pool is the key to this hashtable, specifying the Vector which holds all the (SimProcess/number of requested resources)-pairs.

parameterdescription.para: desmoj.Res : The resource pool which has provided the resources. (The key to the hashtable)
desmoj.SimProcess : The Simprocess giving back his allocated resources. He should be done with the resources now.
int : The number of resources the SimProcess has used.

detaileddescription.para: Deletes an entry in the resource data base (should be called when a Sim-process receives it's requested number of resources from a resource pool (Res )). The resource pool and the number of requested resources will be deleted in the request hashtable. The Sim-process is the key to this hashtable, specifying the RequestedResources object which holds the (resource pool/number of requested resources)-pair.

parameterdescription.para: desmoj.SimProcess : The Simprocess giving up his request for the resources. Hopefully he gets satisfied.
desmoj.Res : The resource pool which provides the resources.
int : The number of resources the SimProcess gets.

detaileddescription.para: Makes an entry in the resource data base when a SimProcess is allocating a number of resources from a resource pool (Res). The Sim-process and the number of allocated resources will be saved in the assignment hashtable. The resource pool is the key to this hashtable.

parameterdescription.para: desmoj.Res : The resource pool which is providing the resources.
desmoj.SimProcess : The Simprocess which is allocating the resources.
int : The number of resources the SimProcess is allocating.

detaileddescription.para: Makes an entry in the resource data base when a SimProcess is requesting a number of resources from a resource pool (Res). The resource pool and the number of requested resources will be saved in the request hashtable. The SimProcess is the key to this hashtable.

parameterdescription.para: desmoj.SimProcess : The Simprocess which is requesting the resources.
desmoj.Res : The resource pool which should provide the resources.
int : The number of resources the SimProcess wants to get.

detaileddescription.para: Returns a string representation of the resource database with some HTML formatting tags. Lists first for every SimProcess all the resources he is requesting and second for every resource pool (Res) all the SimProcesses that are using resources from that resource pool. This information is useful for debugging purposes.

simplesect.para: java.lang.String : The string representation of this resource database.

detaileddescription.para: In the resource database every Simprocess and the resources it requests or holds at the moment are stored. This information is needed i.e. for detecting deadlocks. An instance will be created, when an experiment is created.
